[36mNear the Shore of Newsea[0;37m
    Waves from the Newsea crash onto the shoreline, sending spray of salty
water into the air. Strong gusts from the north whip at your clothes and
kick sand and water droplets into your face. From the eastern horizon to
the western horizon, all that can be seen are the waters of the Newsea.
Directly across the waters to the north you can barely make out a land mass
and a city, it must be Port o'Call. The sand along the shore becomes more
sparse to the south and a road leads away from the shoreline.
[33m[1mA large ferry braves rough waters of the Newsea.

[36mThe Shores of Great Bay[0;37m
    The yellowish sands seamlessly slope into the waters of Newsea as the
waters ebb and flow along the shoreline. The sounds of the sea rhythmically
wash alongst the shore, offering a consistent melody. The caw of sea birds
can be heard before they are seen, taking off and landing atop the waters
to the west. The sandy beach leads eastwards and comes to a trailhead,
leading through some verdant rolling hills. The sky is partially cloudy,
and a drizzle of rain can be felt from time to time.

[36mA Trail to the Shore[0;37m
    The trail descends rapidly, the end of which can be seen leading to a
sandy shoreline. The waters of Newsea can be seen rushing onto the shore,
staining the sand with moisture. Far to the southeast, beyond the hills,
the terrain opens up into a vast desert known as the Plains of Dust. There
is almost a distinguishable line where the sands from the plains meets the
grass at the edge of the hills. The sun warms the hills, but some light
gray rain clouds can be seen moving in from the west.
[33m[1m[0;37m[31m[1m<Myth> Yaza Daza, Mystical Light is standing here. (flying) (invisible) (white aura)

[36mA Trail Through the Hills[0;37m
    The trail cuts through the rolling hills and slopes gently downwards to
the west. There are very few trees present, but there is an abundance of
green grass. Far to the south, beyond the hills, the terrain opens up into
a vast desert known as the Plains of Dust. There is almost a
distinguishable line where the sands from the plains meets the grass at the
edge of the hills. The sun warms the hills, and provides nourishment for
the vegetation.

thick and hazy, each breath like drowning in lava.

[36mCrossing the Thon-Thalas River[0;37m
    The beating sun bakes the dirt road in such heat that the road has
cracked into what almost resembles cobblestones. Insects scurry across,
careful not to stay in the heat for long, lest they become a permanent
melted fixture of the road. Shimmering waves of heat rise off of the road,
distorting your vision slightly. Far to the east, the lands of Khur lie
between here and the Balifor Bay, though all that can be seen is desert.
Somewhere located within is the City of Pashin, a hodgepodge city with both
Dwarven and Solamnic architecture. Often used as a stopping point for
caravans and trade wagons, Pashin is rumored to have one of the finest
bazaars in Ansalon. There is no shade in this stretch of road, and the only
option is to continue either north or south.

[36mSkirting the Foothills[0;37m
    The narrow road twists and winds around the larger foothills here.
These hills are the southern extent of the mightly Khalkist Mountains which
loom over you to the north. The peaks are such a bleak, dark grey, they
almost look charred against the sky. To the south the rocky road flattens
somewhat into more hilly foothills while those to the north only become
more treacherous and rocky. In the distance you can see faint signs of
smoke barely rising above the foothills far to the southwest.

around you. Gazing to the west you notice a huge column of black smoke

imperceptibly, trembling in response to the volcano in the distance.  
The road is barely visible now, as sheer walls of rock flanking the 
bottoms of mountains are all about you.

[36mSkirting the Khalkist Mountains[0;37m
    The lands of Ak-Tubal and Kalin Ak-Phan stretch out to the east. They
are flat, dry, grassy plains infamous for their unbearable heat during the
summer solstice. Although the conditions can be harsh, you can see several
clumps of hardwoods providing some shade for travellers. Far east beyond
the huge plains you can barely make out the glittering waves of the Khurman
Sea. The altitude descends north of there, though to the south you can see
the jagged, towering peaks of the mighty Khalkist Mountains.

boulder, probably the result of a recent avalanche. No signs of life or
civilization can be seen in sight, as there are few footprints and no wagon
ruts on this rugged road.

[36mOn a Cool Road[0;37m
    A flat, wavy sea of grass expands around you. Wildflowers break the
verdant monotony of the vegetation underfoot occasionally, and several wild
fruit trees and roses also dot this path of mulch. A cool breeze blows in
from the northeast. The Khurman Sea, also known as the Bay of Balifor, is
not far from here. In the distance to the southwest, beyond several
foothills, you can barely make out the towering peaks of the Khalkhist
Mountains.

[36mApproaching the Hills of Khuri-Khan[0;37m
    Amidst the cool breezes and verdant expanse of grasses is this cool
road. Composed of mulch and dark black soil, the road curves east towards
the Khurman Sea and west towards the Khalkist mountains. This seems to be a
favored resting place of travelers, as there are several charred circles
near the path where the grass grows shorter. A large apple tree provides
shade over these campsites, as well as food and protection from the
elements. The cool breeze continues, undaunted, rolling in off of the waves
of the Khurman Sea, making you feel relaxed if but for a moment.

Sanction to Neraka, and vice versa. The caw of birds overhead, giant
carrion vulture and tiny sparrow alike, fill the air with a cacophany of
cries.

reminder that life goes on despite the efforts of the Dark Queen.

[36mApproaching the Hills of Khuri-Khan[0;37m
    Amidst the cool breezes and verdant expanse of grasses is this cool
road. Composed of mulch and dark black soil, the road curves east towards
the Khurman Sea and west towards the Khalkist mountains. This seems to be a
favored resting place of travelers, as there are several charred circles
near the path where the grass grows shorter. A large apple tree provides
shade over these campsites, as well as food and protection from the
elements. The cool breeze continues, undaunted, rolling in off of the waves
of the Khurman Sea, making you feel relaxed if but for a moment.

[36mOutside the City of Delphon[0;37m
    An old road leads north into the southern entrance of the city of
Delphon, a sprawling desert city amid the shifting sand. Black iron gates
sit within a thick clay wall that runs across your vision to the north,
while the road fades away as it heads south where it meets a small trail
running east and west. There is little movement here besides the denizens
of the desert, as little human traffic runs through Delphon apart from the
occasional merchant. The banners of the Green Dragomary wave above the
ramparts above, providing a clear signal of who runs the city.

[36mOutside the Southern Gates of Delphon[0;37m
    The southern gates of Delphon loom to the north, their heavy iron
supports gleaming a dull black in the light. The giant clay walls tower
above, protecting the city in a hardened shell. Ramparts have been placed
atop the gates, with several soldiers patrolling them. To the south, a
small path through the sand sweeps around Delphon. It is used by those who
dislike the hostility of the once beautiful city.

[36mOutside the City of Delphon[0;37m
    An old road leads north into the southern entrance of the city of
Delphon, a sprawling desert city amid the shifting sand. Black iron gates
sit within a thick clay wall that runs across your vision to the north,
while the road fades away as it heads south where it meets a small trail
running east and west. There is little movement here besides the denizens
of the desert, as little human traffic runs through Delphon apart from the
occasional merchant. The banners of the Green Dragomary wave above the
ramparts above, providing a clear signal of who runs the city.

[36mNear the City of Delphon[0;37m
    The road begins to narrow as it heads to the east, before the looming
black iron gates of Delphon, ruled by the evil grasp of the Green
Dragonarmy. The city rises amid the sprawling desert like a shimmering
mirage, its solid clay walls standing firm against the constant attack by
the wind-blown sand. Occasionally a merchant will pass by, one of the many
filling their pockets as they fill the needs of the soldiers within
Delphon. A small path runs to the southwest of here, skirting around the
city for those who wish to avoid the pervasive evil of the Dragonarmy.

[36mEntering a Barren Desert[0;37m
    The open expanses of desert sands stretch out in all directions. The
barren and desolate landscape exudes a deep emptiness which is compounded

ground as the sand releases the remnant energy of the desert's sun. A
welcome cool wind breezes in from the south, acting as a guide out of the
unforgiving seas of sand.

    Cacti of all shapes and sizes are growing in this section of the
desert, with a population density that is simply astounding. There are
hundreds of cacti of every sort imaginable, from towering columns to

including red, green, blue, yellow and even a few white cacti. Some of them
are covered with beautiful blooming flowers further adding to the
spectacle. This is a multi-coloured desert wonder to behold, although the
maze of spiked cacti does make the area a little tricky to navigate.

[36mThe Outskirts of an Obsidian Quarry[0;37m
    The desert sands begin to recede revealing a smooth layer of solid
black rock underneath. The black stone substance seems to radiance the
desert's heat, pushing the temperature in this area to an almost unbearable

the lack of weather erosion betraying its young age. An overly elaborate
metal gate set in the fence marks the entrance to an area bustling with
activity. The distinct sounds of machinery and metal digging implements
striking stone can be heard echoing through the warm air. Large dust clouds
have been stirred up by the commotion to the east and rise high into the
air above.

[36mThe Desolate Desert Expanse[0;37m
    This desolate portion of desert is terrifyingly empty. The ground is
completely void of any plant life, it is simply a flat sandy wasteland that

sky high above, hoping that the desert's heat takes its toll soon, bringing
them a fresh meal.

[36mThe Shifting Sands[0;37m
    The sandy floor of the desert in this area seems to have a will of its
own, shifting and moving at its own accord. The tumultuous motion of the
sands makes movement difficult and threatens to swallow anything that
remains stationary for too long. The swift desert winds carry sand through
the air, forming small sandstorms which twirl out of control before losing
their momentum and dissipating. The desert is in a constant state of
chaotic motion here, with sand moving both underfoot and through the air.
What could cause such instability is uncertain, but there is an eerie and
unnatural feeling that lingers in this place.

[36mIn a Cactus Garden[0;37m
    Cacti of all shapes and sizes are growing in this section of the
desert, with a population density that is simply astounding. There are
hundreds of cacti of every sort imaginable, from towering columns to
low-lying clusters. The colour variety is quite incredible as well
including red, green, blue, yellow and even a few white cacti. Some of them
are covered with beautiful blooming flowers further adding to the
spectacle. This is a multi-coloured desert wonder to behold, although the
maze of spiked cacti does make the area a little tricky to navigate.

[36mThe Outskirts of an Obsidian Quarry[0;37m
    The desert sands begin to recede revealing a smooth layer of solid
black rock underneath. The black stone substance seems to radiance the
desert's heat, pushing the temperature in this area to an almost unbearable
level. A finely crafted metal fence has been constructed here to the east,
the lack of weather erosion betraying its young age. An overly elaborate
metal gate set in the fence marks the entrance to an area bustling with
activity. The distinct sounds of machinery and metal digging implements
striking stone can be heard echoing through the warm air. Large dust clouds
have been stirred up by the commotion to the east and rise high into the
air above.

[36mIn an Obsidian Quarry[0;37m
    This deep quarry has been carefully dug into a layer of thick black
obsidian stone. Deep gouges scar the walls from the excavation process and
chipped fragments of stone layer the floor. Dark dust clouds kicked up by
the digging activities swirl in the sky above, which are occasionally
scattered by gusts of desert wind. The temperature in the quarry is
extremely hot. The obsidian stone seems to absorb and retain the desert's
heat and radiate its energy outwards like a huge black oven. The quarry
continues to the east and north, while the desert lies beyond the intricate
metal gate to the west.

dig site hits its boundary. Deep gouges scar the stone walls from the
excavation process and chipped fragments of stone layer the floor. Dark
dust clouds kicked up by the digging activities swirl in the sky above,

in the quarry is extremely hot. The obsidian stone seems to absorb and
retain the desert's heat and radiate its energy like a huge black furnace.

up to the east.

[36mThe Head Archaeologist's Tent[0;37m
    The inside of this large tent is filled with dusty maps and schematics,
looking very much like the centre of the digging operation. Black dust
kicked up from the quarry excavations has coated much of the contents of
the tent, having been blown through the entrance by the desert wind that
swirls around the digsite. Covering most of the western wall is a massive
map of the quarry with a series of pins stuck in it, possibly marking where
significant finds have been made. A warm breeze blows through the opening
on the southern wall which leads back to the swelteringly hot quarry.
[33m[1mGleaming brightly, a large steel shovel rests on the floor.

[36mA Corner in the Quarry[0;37m
    The black stone perimeter of the quarry takes a sharp turn here as the
dig site hits its boundary. Deep gouges scar the stone walls from the
excavation process and chipped fragments of stone layer the floor. Dark
dust clouds kicked up by the digging activities swirl in the sky above,
which are occasionally scattered by gusts of desert wind. The temperature
in the quarry is extremely hot. The obsidian stone seems to absorb and
retain the desert's heat and radiate its energy like a huge black furnace.
The quarry continues to the south and a huge plateau of black stone rises
up to the east.

[36mA Jagged Outcrop of Obsidian[0;37m
    An enormous, pitch black outcrop of obsidian stone rises out of the
desert sands. The outcrop is thickest at its base and thins as it rises
upwards to a slightly curved point, giving it the appearance of a shark's
dorsal fin slicing through the sand. Unmarred by erosion, the rock's glossy
black surface shines dully as the light catches it. A large bird's nest of
sticks and straw rests in a craggy upper section of the outcrop where the
pitch black stone acts as a windbreak to protect it from the harsh desert
winds. The obsidian stone seems to radiate heat, as if it absorbs and
retains the energy from its surroundings.

[36mA Jagged Outcrop of Obsidian[0;37m
    An enormous, pitch black outcrop of obsidian stone rises out of the
desert sands. The outcrop is thickest at its base and thins as it rises
upwards to a slightly curved point, giving it the appearance of a shark's
dorsal fin slicing through the sand. Unmarred by erosion, the rock's glossy
black surface shines dully as the light catches it. A large bird's nest of
sticks and straw rests in a craggy upper section of the outcrop where the
pitch black stone acts as a windbreak to protect it from the harsh desert
winds. The obsidian stone seems to radiate heat, as if it absorbs and
retains the energy from its surroundings.

Looking north:
A massive jagged outcrop of pitch black stone stands tall.
Looking east:
The sea of dunes continue their rise and fall as far as the eye can see.
Looking south:
Desolate, sandy landscape stretches out to the horizon.
Looking west:
The bleak desert terrain is devoid of life and emanates a deep emptiness.
Looking up:
A few black birds circle high in the sky above.

    This desolate portion of desert is terrifyingly empty. The ground is
completely void of any plant life, it is simply a flat sandy wasteland that
seems to go on forever. Sweltering heat has scorched the sands and
threatens to extinguish all life from the area. The despair and emptiness
of the surroundings is deafening. It feels like the desert could swallow up
any poor creature that loses its way here. Some black birds circle in the
sky high above, hoping that the desert's heat takes its toll soon, bringing
them a fresh meal.

[36mThe Shifting Sands[0;37m
    The sandy floor of the desert in this area seems to have a will of its
own, shifting and moving at its own accord. The tumultuous motion of the
sands makes movement difficult and threatens to swallow anything that
remains stationary for too long. The swift desert winds carry sand through
the air, forming small sandstorms which twirl out of control before losing
their momentum and dissipating. The desert is in a constant state of
chaotic motion here, with sand moving both underfoot and through the air.
What could cause such instability is uncertain, but there is an eerie and
unnatural feeling that lingers in this place.

[36mIn a Cactus Garden[0;37m
    Cacti of all shapes and sizes are growing in this section of the
desert, with a population density that is simply astounding. There are
hundreds of cacti of every sort imaginable, from towering columns to
low-lying clusters. The colour variety is quite incredible as well
including red, green, blue, yellow and even a few white cacti. Some of them
are covered with beautiful blooming flowers further adding to the
spectacle. This is a multi-coloured desert wonder to behold, although the
maze of spiked cacti does make the area a little tricky to navigate.

[36mThe Deserts of Khur[0;37m
    Coarse desert sand blankets the area, littered with the bones of
animals who fell victim to the unrelenting sun. Powerful winds howl over
the sands surface, searching for any source of moisture to suck dry. The
occasional tumbleweed bounces along to the rhythm of the wind and a few
creatures scurry across the sands searching desperately for food, but the
harsh desert doesn't part with any such luxury easily. Cloudless skies meet
sandy dunes on every horizon as the desolate desert stretches farther than
the eye can see.

[36mA Jagged Outcrop of Obsidian[0;37m
    An enormous, pitch black outcrop of obsidian stone rises out of the
desert sands. The outcrop is thickest at its base and thins as it rises
upwards to a slightly curved point, giving it the appearance of a shark's
dorsal fin slicing through the sand. Unmarred by erosion, the rock's glossy
black surface shines dully as the light catches it. A large bird's nest of
sticks and straw rests in a craggy upper section of the outcrop where the
pitch black stone acts as a windbreak to protect it from the harsh desert
winds. The obsidian stone seems to radiate heat, as if it absorbs and
retains the energy from its surroundings.

[36mThe Outskirts of an Obsidian Quarry[0;37m
    The desert sands begin to recede revealing a smooth layer of solid
black rock underneath. The black stone substance seems to radiance the
desert's heat, pushing the temperature in this area to an almost unbearable
level. A finely crafted metal fence has been constructed here to the east,
the lack of weather erosion betraying its young age. An overly elaborate
metal gate set in the fence marks the entrance to an area bustling with
activity. The distinct sounds of machinery and metal digging implements
striking stone can be heard echoing through the warm air. Large dust clouds
have been stirred up by the commotion to the east and rise high into the
air above.

[36mUpon the Edge of a Cliff[0;37m
    The desert sands end abruptly here, revealing solid black stone
underneath. On the eastern edge of this stone area a steep cliff gives way
to the desert valley below. The obsidian stone ledge overhangs the valley
wall at such an angle that climbing down the cliff itself would be
impossible. The wind whistles through the area and skims over the top of
the valley. The black stone cliffs retain and radiate the desert's energy,
pushing the temperature in this area to an almost unbearable level. Whilst
to the north and south the desert's sands resume their domination of the
scenery, a jagged obsidian outcrop looms large over the bleak landscape to
the west.

[36mAtop a Tall Desert Dune[0;37m
    This particularly large sand dune stands high above the desert below
and the view from its peak is simply breathtaking. Tiny smatterings of
green flora blot the endless seas of sand that surround the dune and
stretch outwards to the horizons. A gorgeously green oasis to the far north
east looks completely out of place in the panoramic view of the harsh
deserts, though the splash of colour in the otherwise desolate landscape is
quite refreshing. The beginning of a high walled city stands in the
desert's sands at the base of the dune to the west.

[36mThe Gates of Khuri-Khan[0;37m
    A large copper portcullis set in high stone walls marks the entrance to
the desert city of Khuri-Khan, home of the Khur tribe. Sporadically flying
along the city's walls are the flags and banners of the Green Dragonarmy
which gently flutter in the breeze. A dusty path passes under the
portcullis moving into the city, a few camels and horses have been tied to
stakes beside it ensuring they remain until their masters return.
Silhouettes of well clothed figures can be seen walking in the city up
ahead, their movement kicking up clouds of dust as they go about their
daily business. Scattered in the nearby vicinity are a number of dirty
canvas tents, the temporary homes of nomadic people visiting the city. A
tall sand dune rises up to the east marking the way back to the desert.

[36mA Dark, Mist Filled Tent[0;37m
    Drenched in shadows, this gloomy tent does not reveal its contents to
the eye easily. The humid, misty air swirls around the tent working in
tandem with the shadows to conceal the surroundings. A small fireplace
crackles in the centre of the tent and a tiny black iron pot has been
placed on top of it. As the fire licks the pot's iron, wisps of gaseous
purple smoke rise out of it and upward into the darkness. Eerie charms
constructed of animal bone and sinew hang from somewhere above, rattling
gently as the air circulates. There is an ominous feeling lingering here,
like the lost souls of the desert seek to re-enter the world of the living
through this very tent.

[36mA Dark, Mist Filled Tent[0;37m
    Drenched in shadows, this gloomy tent does not reveal its contents to
the eye easily. The humid, misty air swirls around the tent working in
tandem with the shadows to conceal the surroundings. A small fireplace
crackles in the centre of the tent and a tiny black iron pot has been
placed on top of it. As the fire licks the pot's iron, wisps of gaseous
purple smoke rise out of it and upward into the darkness. Eerie charms
constructed of animal bone and sinew hang from somewhere above, rattling
gently as the air circulates. There is an ominous feeling lingering here,
like the lost souls of the desert seek to re-enter the world of the living
through this very tent.

[36mThe Gates of Khuri-Khan[0;37m
    A large copper portcullis set in high stone walls marks the entrance to
the desert city of Khuri-Khan, home of the Khur tribe. Sporadically flying
along the city's walls are the flags and banners of the Green Dragonarmy
which gently flutter in the breeze. A dusty path passes under the
portcullis moving into the city, a few camels and horses have been tied to
stakes beside it ensuring they remain until their masters return.
Silhouettes of well clothed figures can be seen walking in the city up
ahead, their movement kicking up clouds of dust as they go about their
daily business. Scattered in the nearby vicinity are a number of dirty
canvas tents, the temporary homes of nomadic people visiting the city. A
tall sand dune rises up to the east marking the way back to the desert.

[36mAtop a Tall Desert Dune[0;37m
    This particularly large sand dune stands high above the desert below
and the view from its peak is simply breathtaking. Tiny smatterings of
green flora blot the endless seas of sand that surround the dune and
stretch outwards to the horizons. A gorgeously green oasis to the far north
east looks completely out of place in the panoramic view of the harsh
deserts, though the splash of colour in the otherwise desolate landscape is
quite refreshing. The beginning of a high walled city stands in the
desert's sands at the base of the dune to the west.

[36mUpon the Edge of a Cliff[0;37m
    The desert sands end abruptly here, revealing solid black stone
underneath. On the eastern edge of this stone area a steep cliff gives way
to the desert valley below. The obsidian stone ledge overhangs the valley
wall at such an angle that climbing down the cliff itself would be
impossible. The wind whistles through the area and skims over the top of
the valley. The black stone cliffs retain and radiate the desert's energy,
pushing the temperature in this area to an almost unbearable level. Whilst
to the north and south the desert's sands resume their domination of the
scenery, a jagged obsidian outcrop looms large over the bleak landscape to
the west.

[36mThe Desolate Desert Expanse[0;37m
    This desolate portion of desert is terrifyingly empty. The ground is
completely void of any plant life, it is simply a flat sandy wasteland that
seems to go on forever. Sweltering heat has scorched the sands and
threatens to extinguish all life from the area. The despair and emptiness
of the surroundings is deafening. It feels like the desert could swallow up
any poor creature that loses its way here. Some black birds circle in the
sky high above, hoping that the desert's heat takes its toll soon, bringing
them a fresh meal.

[36mA Jagged Outcrop of Obsidian[0;37m
    An enormous, pitch black outcrop of obsidian stone rises out of the
desert sands. The outcrop is thickest at its base and thins as it rises
upwards to a slightly curved point, giving it the appearance of a shark's
dorsal fin slicing through the sand. Unmarred by erosion, the rock's glossy
black surface shines dully as the light catches it. A large bird's nest of
sticks and straw rests in a craggy upper section of the outcrop where the
pitch black stone acts as a windbreak to protect it from the harsh desert
winds. The obsidian stone seems to radiate heat, as if it absorbs and
retains the energy from its surroundings.

[36mThe Deserts of Khur[0;37m
    Coarse desert sand blankets the area, littered with the bones of
animals who fell victim to the unrelenting sun. Powerful winds howl over
the sands surface, searching for any source of moisture to suck dry. The
occasional tumbleweed bounces along to the rhythm of the wind and a few
creatures scurry across the sands searching desperately for food, but the
harsh desert doesn't part with any such luxury easily. Cloudless skies meet
sandy dunes on every horizon as the desolate desert stretches farther than
the eye can see.

[36mThe Outskirts of an Obsidian Quarry[0;37m
    The desert sands begin to recede revealing a smooth layer of solid
black rock underneath. The black stone substance seems to radiance the
desert's heat, pushing the temperature in this area to an almost unbearable
level. A finely crafted metal fence has been constructed here to the east,
the lack of weather erosion betraying its young age. An overly elaborate
metal gate set in the fence marks the entrance to an area bustling with
activity. The distinct sounds of machinery and metal digging implements
striking stone can be heard echoing through the warm air. Large dust clouds
have been stirred up by the commotion to the east and rise high into the
air above.

[36mIn a Cactus Garden[0;37m

desert, with a population density that is simply astounding. There are
hundreds of cacti of every sort imaginable, from towering columns to
low-lying clusters. The colour variety is quite incredible as well
including red, green, blue, yellow and even a few white cacti. Some of them
are covered with beautiful blooming flowers further adding to the
spectacle. This is a multi-coloured desert wonder to behold, although the
maze of spiked cacti does make the area a little tricky to navigate.

[36mEntering a Barren Desert[0;37m

with its presence every so often. Waves of heat emanate upwards from the
ground as the sand releases the remnant energy of the desert's sun. A
welcome cool wind breezes in from the south, acting as a guide out of the
unforgiving seas of sand.

sandy hills that block your path to the north and east. Despite the barren
nature of this desert, wildlife can be found by those who look; the
occasional dik-dik or roadrunner darts across the wastes, and you catch a
glimpse of a hyena lurking in the shadows of the dune to your north.

[36mMoving Around the Dunes[0;37m

small trail heads north into the wastelands of Khur and east, where it
widens out on the flatter terrain. Small creatures dart about in the sand,
looking for protection from the harsh environment.

[36mBefore A Road[0;37m
    This sandy trail flattens out as it snakes away from the dunes to the

constantly blowing sand but still showing signs of the careful maintenance
received during years gone by. The broken roadway is a welcome sight to
weary travelers who have made the long trek down this desert trail. Sounds
of civilization rise from the city of Delphon that rises to the northeast;
the sturdy clip-clop of shod horses' hooves resonates on the stone amid the
raucous fray from merchants, shoppers, and the guards and soldiers of the
Green Dragonarmy alike.

[36mIntersection of Alan Ak-Khan[0;37m
    Hot, dry flatlands expand around you. The days in the Alan-Ak Khan are
usually lazy, drifting lazily by into history as the sun beats down. This
crossroad is well traveled, both by Green Dragonarmy patrols and merchants
alike. Delphon sprawls out to the west, while the city of Flotsam sits on
the Blood Sea northeast of here. Southeast of these parched flatlands, Port
Balifor abuts the Khurman Sea. As an area of heavy trade, it is no wonder
that bandits frequent these roads.

Yaza flies south.
You follow Yaza south.
The spirit of a red dragonarmy soldier arrives from the north.
The spirit of a Kuo-toa scout flies in from the north.
Fawe flies in from the north.
[36mA Repulsive Ramshackle Hut[0;37m
    The hut can barely be described as a shelter. The walls are made of
wooden poles loosely tied together without any other form of windbreak or
insulation applied to them, allowing the chilly ocean wind to rush through.
The poles supporting the roof are rotting away as is the grass thatching on
top of it, leaving large holes where there is nothing to keep out the
weather. As a result the exposed ground floor of the hut is a swampy
quagmire of mud and, from the smell of it, excrement and rotting food.
Around the perimeter are large bundles of animal hides, probably blankets
and bedding material, beset with lice, fleas, and ticks.
[33m[1m[0;37m[31m[1m<Myth> Fawe the Male Half Elf is standing here. (flying) (white aura)
The spirit of a Kuo-toa scout is hovering here. (grey aura)

<Myth> Yaza Daza, Mystical Light is standing here. (flying) (invisible) (white aura)
<Myth> Sir Yazzi Dragonbane is standing here. (flying) (invisible) (white aura)
An ogre snores loudly in a deep sleep. (black aura)
An ogre snores loudly in a deep sleep. (black aura)
[0;37m
[32m[0;37m[32m349H [0;37m[33m[1m76V [0;37m34409571X 35.05% 907C [0;37mT:28 Exits:N>

The spirit of a red dragonarmy soldier arrives from the south.
The spirit of a Kuo-toa scout flies in from the south.
Fawe flies in from the south.
[36mA Filthy Street[0;37m
    A strong unbearable stench rises from the very mud you walk on, making
you wonder if it is, indeed, mud. Surrounding the street, clustered
together in tight groups, are rickety wooden huts. Each of the crude homes
seems ready to fall down and were not built with skill or care, most
looking as though they were hastily thrown together. The street continues
toward the center of the village to the east and toward the entrance to the
west.

[36mThe Village Center[0;37m
    The center of this village is little more than a large bog surrounded
by dozens of dilapidated wooden huts. The overpowering stench of rot,
decay, and excrement that surrounds everything is strongest here. Two
streets intersect, one running to the north and south, the other, the main
street through the village, running east and west.

[36mA Filthy Street[0;37m
    A strong unbearable stench rises from the very mud you walk on, making
you wonder if it is, indeed, mud. Surrounding the street, clustered
together in tight groups, are rickety wooden huts. Each of the crude homes
seems ready to fall down and were not built with skill or care, most
looking as though they were hastily thrown together. The street continues
toward the center of the village to the east and toward the entrance to the
west.

[36mA Repulsive Ramshackle Hut[0;37m
    The hut can barely be described as a shelter. The walls are made of
wooden poles loosely tied together without any other form of windbreak or
insulation applied to them, allowing the chilly ocean wind to rush through.
The poles supporting the roof are rotting away as is the grass thatching on
top of it, leaving large holes where there is nothing to keep out the
weather. As a result the exposed ground floor of the hut is a swampy
quagmire of mud and, from the smell of it, excrement and rotting food.
Around the perimeter are large bundles of animal hides, probably blankets
and bedding material, beset with lice, fleas, and ticks.

[36mA Filthy Street[0;37m

you wonder if it is, indeed, mud. Surrounding the street, clustered
together in tight groups, are rickety wooden huts. Each of the crude homes
seems ready to fall down and were not built with skill or care, most
looking as though they were hastily thrown together. The street continues
toward the center of the village to the east and toward the entrance to the
west.

[36mVillage Center of Dragon's Point[0;37m
    The foot traffic is relatively light in the center of the village. A
small stone water fountain is the central point of the square and there is
a large official-looking building that appears to be better maintained than
the other buildings in the rest of the village. Loud merry sounds echo from
a nearby tavern, which is the major gathering point for most of the
villagers when they are not out fishing. A large flag pole has been erected
in front of the town hall.

[36mA Floating Dock[0;37m
    The docks abruptly end here in the deeper waters of the harbor. Loud
sounds echo from a massive fishing boat that is attached to a large
gangway. Many of the local fishermen are attending to this boat and can be
seen running around the dock near it. Old empty traps, cut nets, and broken
crates are littering the side of the dock.

[36mNearing Dragon's Point[0;37m
    To the west the docks of Dragon's Point can be seen, a speck of
civilization amonst the wild grasslands. Pink-white foam spins in
uncontrolled spirals, driven by the waves and the winds whipping from the
sanguine sea, creating fleeting patterns of cerise bubbles. These waters,
poisoned by the death and daring of the Cataclysm, have been stained as red
as blood, with a high salt content which makes it seem almost as thick, as
well. Dyed by the crimson waters, massive colonies of kelp float a few feet
beneath the surface, striped with sable and magenta, appropriately known as
bloodwrack.

[36mAlong the Coast of the Dancing Woods[0;37m
    To the north the tall pines of the Dancing Woods tower over the
Nightmare Sea. Deep beneath the surface of the Blood Sea dark shapes can be
seen flitting perilously among the submerged castles and keeps which once
dotted the Istarian countryside. The waters feel unnaturally thick, like
clotted blood, and the air seems preternaturally humid and heavy, as if the
weight of the souls of those drowned below somehow drags the very ether
downwards. Driven by the sempiternal tempest at the center of the waves,
the winds howl in hideous lament, mourning the wrath of the gods and
weeping at the arrogance of man.

[36mAlong the Coast of the Dancing Woods[0;37m
    In the distance the waving trees of the Dancing Woods gyre and gimbal.
The waters feel unnaturally thick, like clotted blood, and the air seems
preternaturally humid and heavy, as if the weight of the souls of those
drowned below somehow drags the very ether downwards. A massive whirlpool
lies as the center of the violent sea, thrashing and spinning with barbaric
intensity, threatening to swallow anything foolish enough to approach its
voracious torque. Glowering with repugnant fury, a gargantuan black cloud
lies in the very middle of the waters, darkening the sherried waves to an
atramentous burgundy.

[36mThe Blood Sea of Istar[0;37m
    The waters become more treacherous south of Saifhum. These waters,
poisoned by the death and daring of the Cataclysm, have been stained as red
as blood, with a high salt content which makes it seem almost as thick, as
well. Dyed by the crimson waters, massive colonies of kelp float a few feet
beneath the surface, striped with sable and magenta, appropriately known as
bloodwrack. Deep beneath the surface of the Blood Sea dark shapes can be
seen flitting perilously among the submerged castles and keeps which once
dotted the Istarian countryside.

ocean, the perfume of loss and hubris leaving an indelible mark upon the

[36mSaifhum Crossing[0;37m
    This broad waterway passes between the Dancing Woods and the Island of
Saifhum. Glowering with repugnant fury, a gargantuan black cloud lies in
the very middle of the waters, darkening the sherried waves to an
atramentous burgundy. The bracing smell of the salt air is undercut by the
unmistakable odor of decay from within the forlorn ocean, the perfume of
loss and hubris leaving an indelible mark upon the senses. Rising ten to
fifteen feet above the sea level, giant waves menace any watercraft stupid
enough to brave the doomed sea-lanes, rioting with mindless atrocity
against the autonomy of the gods themselves.

[36mNearing the Island of Saifhum[0;37m
    The craggy coastline of Saifhum rises above the nightmare sea, too
steep to climb. The bracing smell of the salt air is undercut by the
unmistakable odor of decay from within the forlorn ocean, the perfume of
loss and hubris leaving an indelible mark upon the senses. Rising ten to
fifteen feet above the sea level, giant waves menace any watercraft stupid
enough to brave the doomed sea-lanes, rioting with mindless atrocity
against the autonomy of the gods themselves.

[36mNearing a Rocky Island[0;37m
     Ominous dark waters churn all around you, making a loud roaring noise.
A few sickly-yellow clumps of kelp have floated to the surface of the
water, and are now subject to the thrashing of the waves. Seagulls and
other birds fly overhead, occasionally swooping down to pick up their food.
Looking westward, you see some jagged cliffs rising up from the beachhead
of the island. Once known to be uninhabited, it is now rumoured that
pirates have taken over the island and made it their base of operations. If
it were indeed inhabited by pirates, it would prove to be a profitable
adventure. Legends about the wealth of the pirates in the blood sea area
are known all over Krynn.

[36mBefore the Lighthouse[0;37m
     You stand immediately before an ancient lighthouse, made of rough-hewn
stone. The lighthouse juts far into the skyline, rising several hundred
feet from the plateau. Several small openings are spaced equidistant from
each other, helping to illuminate the interior of the lighthouse at any
time of day. Lichen plague the surface of the rough rock surface, further
testament to how long the lighthouse has withstood the test of time. A set
of massive doors, made from solid oak, block the only entrance into the
lighthouse. Looking far above, you make out reflections from the mirrors
atop the lighthouse. It appears that even in this day and age, the
lighthouse is in use.

[36mNearing the Lighthouse[0;37m
     You are less than five hundred paces from the lighthouse. From this
distance, you are able to clearly see just how big the lighthouse is, and
moreover, what kind of condition it is in. For having purportedly survived
the Cataclysm, it looks to be in near pristine condition. As you walk
closer towards the lighthouse and change your angle, you see reflections
bouncing off of the large mirrors atop the lighthouse, proving that indeed
it is still in use. The thought of who, or possibly even what, lives in
side sends chills deep down your spine.

[36mA Hidden Path[0;37m
     You are now walking along an overgrown path, barely visible to the
unaided eye. There are very few signs of traffic on this path, which leads
south to the lighthouse and east to yet another cliff. Seagulls circle
lazily above you, their cries of hunger piercing the crimson sky. It
appears as if someone has taken great pains to hide this path and whatever
it may lead to, for reasons you aren't quite sure of.

[36mBefore the Lighthouse[0;37m
     You stand immediately before an ancient lighthouse, made of rough-hewn
stone. The lighthouse juts far into the skyline, rising several hundred
feet from the plateau. Several small openings are spaced equidistant from
each other, helping to illuminate the interior of the lighthouse at any
time of day. Lichen plague the surface of the rough rock surface, further
testament to how long the lighthouse has withstood the test of time. A set
of massive doors, made from solid oak, block the only entrance into the
lighthouse. Looking far above, you make out reflections from the mirrors
atop the lighthouse. It appears that even in this day and age, the
lighthouse is in use.

[36mNearing the Lighthouse[0;37m

cobblestones line the path, chipped and broken out of the mortar that

[36mPath Along the Sea Cliff[0;37m
     This lazy path runs all around the perimeter of the sea cliff, giving
you a bird's eye view of what is going on far below, which appears to be
little. The view is quite breathtaking and picturesque from here. Looking
north, you see a massive light house, still operated to guide the pirates
into shore safely. Short grasses and patches of flowers frequent the ground
and alongside the path. Looking down to the dirty path itself, you see
hundreds of hoof prints, more than likely from patrolling guards.

[36mEdge of a Treacherous Cliff[0;37m
     You are atop a dangerous and quite treacherous looking cliff. The
beach is some three to four hundred feet below you, and since you don't
feel like pursuing a career as hamburger meat, you tend to stay away from
the edge. All around your northern and eastern sides is a plateau top, with
a path running around the perimeter. Off in the distance, you are able to
see a massive lighthouse that looks like it has been standing since before
the Cataclysm. Rumors of pirates abound in these areas, so you stay on your
guard as you walk along.

[36mSolace Square[0;37m

here rises slightly towards the center of the square, providing a high spot

north, south, east, and west. On one edge of the square, there is a huge
vallenwood which bough supports a collection of huts and buildings. A
small spiral staircase leads up around the trunk of the tree and into the
thick limbs which house the buildings.

be Southern Ergoth. While off to the south east you can make out what must
be Abanasinia.

     The ocean spreads out as far as you can see in all directions, the
foaming crests of the waves rolling beneath you as you travel the sea lanes
of the Sirrion Sea. You see the occasional bird flying high overhead,
giving you some hope at least that land may be found over the horizon at
last. The winds intensify slightly, but seem to be blowing in a consistent
direction at least, pushing you east.

[36mIn Sight of Land[0;37m

distant roar of the surf crashing against the shoreline. Birds circle high
in the sky, tiny specks in the distance, which wheel and dive toward the
foaming crests in search of fish to dine upon. The waters stretch off into
the horizon in all other directions.

[36mAt the Teeth of the Bay[0;37m
     Huge jagged shafts of dark rock rise up out of the sea in several

sharpened and pitted by the elements. Waves crash loudly against the stone
in veritable explosions of water, filling the air with a fine mist. Beyond
these enormous guardians to the east a small bay beckons you to calmer
waters, the force of the wind and waves buffered somewhat by these massive
stone formations.

[36mOn the Bay[0;37m
     A vast collection of boulders rise up out of the waters to the north,
created by the partial collapse of the tall cliffs that hug the shoreline.
Many small barnacles cling to the rock in grim defiance of the elements,
and several dried wispy strands of seaweed stuck to a small ledge above you
indicates that the waters can indeed rise suddenly in the fierce storms
which must batter this part of the coastline. Back to the south and east
the bay spreads out before you, the waters noticeably calmer directly to
the east.

[36mAmong the Jagged Rocks[0;37m
    A constant spray of sea mist from the waves crashing over the jagged
rocks is sent cascading over you, the scent of salt heavy in the air. Many
shallow pools of water and dark crevasses lie in the shadows, between
fallen slabs of rock and underneath dark overhangs cloaking parts of the
rocks in deep shadow. Tiny lifeforms swirl about in the pools, awaiting the
next high tide to free them from their shallow prisons. A large overhang
has produced a natural shelter to the east of you here, protecting its
inhabitants somewhat from the cool winds that blow off the Sirrion Sea from
the west.

[36mUnder the Overhang[0;37m
     A solid piece of ancient rock has fallen across several other large
slabs, forming an area somewhat sheltered from the chilly sea-borne winds.
A small pool of water near the entrance ripples with the fallen spray sent
from the waves crashing against the barrier, the excess slowly draining off
over the eastern edge back into the sea. To the north and west tall jagged
shards of stone stand in defiance to the ravages of the elements, weakening
the waves considerably before they enter the bay. The wind whistles through
the small cracks in the rocky mounds, bringing with it an unusual musky
odour.

[36mAt the Base of the Rockpile[0;37m

seawater occasionally when the tide smashes with enough force against the
far side of the natural barrier. Several well positioned slabs of rock
would allow you to traverse to higher ground here, if you took the
necessary care with your footing.

[36mClimbing the Rockpile[0;37m
     Upon entering the top of the rockpile you are immediately struck by
the intensity of the winds blowing against the rocky barrier. A small gap
in two soaring boulders allow the wind to howl through them, creating a
high pitched whistling sound. Sea spray cascades through the gap in time to
the sound of the waves bashing against the remainder of its unseen face,
covering you in a light spray of salty water. A single huge slab has fallen
to lay horizontally atop several other tall boulders to the southwest,
creating a covered shelter underneath, and a large platform above - exposed
to much of the natural light, yet still protected from the fierce winds and
a majority of the spray.

[36mOn Top of the Overhang[0;37m

boulders to create a natural platform overlooking the rocky ground below
you. From this height, you can see the many jagged shards of solid rock
reaching up to touch the horizon at the entrance to the bay, the peculiar

fine layer of slippery water that slowly drains into tiny unseen cracks in
the stone.

[36mPrecariously Balanced on the Rocks[0;37m
     Boulders and jagged outcroppings of rock have piled up here between
the northwestern entrance to the bay and the tall cliffs rising to the
east, forming a natural barrier against the sea. The western horizon
spreads out before you, an impressive vista of the choppy waters, which is
only broken by the several massive shards of stone thrust up out of the sea
at the bay entrance. A single huge slab of solid stone has fallen against
the boulders to the south, allowing you to climb in this direction and look
down over the interior of the boulder strewn barrier below.

[36mClimbing the Rockpile[0;37m
     Upon entering the top of the rockpile you are immediately struck by
the intensity of the winds blowing against the rocky barrier. A small gap
in two soaring boulders allow the wind to howl through them, creating a
high pitched whistling sound. Sea spray cascades through the gap in time to
the sound of the waves bashing against the remainder of its unseen face,
covering you in a light spray of salty water. A single huge slab has fallen
to lay horizontally atop several other tall boulders to the southwest,
creating a covered shelter underneath, and a large platform above - exposed
to much of the natural light, yet still protected from the fierce winds and
a majority of the spray.

[36mOn Top of the Overhang[0;37m
     A thick slab of solid rock has fallen across several other massive
boulders to create a natural platform overlooking the rocky ground below
you. From this height, you can see the many jagged shards of solid rock
reaching up to touch the horizon at the entrance to the bay, the peculiar
formation reminding you of the sharp teeth of a ferocious predator. The
Sirrion Seas crash against the rocky barrier with enough force for the
resulting spray to be felt even at this height, covering the slab with a
fine layer of slippery water that slowly drains into tiny unseen cracks in
the stone.

[36mAt the Base of the Rockpile[0;37m
     All around the overlapping slabs of rock and boulders have piled up to
surround you, forming a relatively sheltered corridor that leads back off
to the south and then under a large overhanging slab. The sea winds whistle
here as they blow relentlessly through several small weathered cracks in
the rock pile, these same cracks allowing in a slight dribble of foamy
seawater occasionally when the tide smashes with enough force against the
far side of the natural barrier. Several well positioned slabs of rock
would allow you to traverse to higher ground here, if you took the
necessary care with your footing.

[36mAmong Fallen Slabs of Stone[0;37m
     A natural pathway leads between two high walls of fallen stone by the
entrance to this bay in the Sirrion Sea, which you can hear battering
against the stone to the north. A large rock has fallen horizontally across
two huge boulders to the west, forming a natural shelter to the west. The
occasional small pebble falls down from above, leading you to believe some
kind of animal may be scouting around in the rocks above for food. The path
curves to the north, where it seems to terminate in a wall of a rock.

[36mUnder the Overhang[0;37m
     A solid piece of ancient rock has fallen across several other large
slabs, forming an area somewhat sheltered from the chilly sea-borne winds.
A small pool of water near the entrance ripples with the fallen spray sent
from the waves crashing against the barrier, the excess slowly draining off
over the eastern edge back into the sea. To the north and west tall jagged
shards of stone stand in defiance to the ravages of the elements, weakening
the waves considerably before they enter the bay. The wind whistles through
the small cracks in the rocky mounds, bringing with it an unusual musky
odour.

[36mAmong the Jagged Rocks[0;37m
    A constant spray of sea mist from the waves crashing over the jagged
rocks is sent cascading over you, the scent of salt heavy in the air. Many
shallow pools of water and dark crevasses lie in the shadows, between
fallen slabs of rock and underneath dark overhangs cloaking parts of the
rocks in deep shadow. Tiny lifeforms swirl about in the pools, awaiting the
next high tide to free them from their shallow prisons. A large overhang
has produced a natural shelter to the east of you here, protecting its
inhabitants somewhat from the cool winds that blow off the Sirrion Sea from
the west.

[36mSqueezing Through the Crack[0;37m
     A small crack has formed in this massive slab of stone, allowing you
to squeeze through and reach the roaring ocean to the north. The damp walls
of the crack run with many tiny rivulets of sea water, which collect and
drain into other tiny gaps in the narrow convergence of stone which serves
as the floor. Gusty breezes whistle through the narrow opening, carrying
with it a fine spray of water.

[36mFacing the Open Sea[0;37m
     The winds howl and press you against the damp stone, drenching you in
an instant with salty spray. It seems as though the full unbridled fury of
the sea is focusing upon this stone barrier, attempting to wear the stone
away and yet failing to do much more than smooth their jagged edges in many
places. A precarious ledge leads eastward along the barrier face, and a
large crack leads toward shelter to the south.

[36mFacing the Open Sea[0;37m
     The wind whips up a mighty gale that roars in from the northwest and
pushes the waves hard against the stone barrier behind you. Your view of
the horizon is obscured by the dense mist in the air as the foaming waters
crash against the rocks. A slippery ledge leads back to the west, though
there is hardly any shelter there to prevent the spray from soaking you to
the bone either.

[36mA Narrow Defile[0;37m
     Progress along the narrow defile is difficult, you are forced to turn
and sidestep in parts to continue. The sheer granite walls soar high above
allowing only a thin strip of sky to be visible, casting much of the valley
in shadow. Off to the west you can hear the unmistakable sound of the sea
crashing against a breakwater, while the trail you follow at the base of
the defile turns to the north.

the clearing, looking to have been placed evenly around the entrance to a
small tunnel that disappears into the shadows. A narrow trail that is the
floor of the defile leads the way through a twisting path heading south,
which quickly disappears amongst the sheer walls that rise high above you.

[36mA Narrow Defile[0;37m
     Progress along the narrow defile is difficult, you are forced to turn
and sidestep in parts to continue. The sheer granite walls soar high above
allowing only a thin strip of sky to be visible, casting much of the valley
in shadow. Off to the west you can hear the unmistakable sound of the sea
crashing against a breakwater, while the trail you follow at the base of
the defile turns to the north.

[36mA Narrow Defile[0;37m
     The cramped trail terminates in a small clearing, overlooked by walls
on all sides, bar south, which are so steep as to be impossible to climb. A
series of strange looking stones lies heaped up against the eastern side of
the clearing, looking to have been placed evenly around the entrance to a
small tunnel that disappears into the shadows. A narrow trail that is the
floor of the defile leads the way through a twisting path heading south,
which quickly disappears amongst the sheer walls that rise high above you.

[36mSqueezing Through the Crack[0;37m

to squeeze through and reach the roaring ocean to the north. The damp walls
of the crack run with many tiny rivulets of sea water, which collect and
drain into other tiny gaps in the narrow convergence of stone which serves
as the floor. Gusty breezes whistle through the narrow opening, carrying
with it a fine spray of water.

[36mAmong the Jagged Rocks[0;37m
    A constant spray of sea mist from the waves crashing over the jagged
rocks is sent cascading over you, the scent of salt heavy in the air. Many
shallow pools of water and dark crevasses lie in the shadows, between
fallen slabs of rock and underneath dark overhangs cloaking parts of the
rocks in deep shadow. Tiny lifeforms swirl about in the pools, awaiting the
next high tide to free them from their shallow prisons. A large overhang
has produced a natural shelter to the east of you here, protecting its
inhabitants somewhat from the cool winds that blow off the Sirrion Sea from
the west.

and several dried wispy strands of seaweed stuck to a small ledge above you
indicates that the waters can indeed rise suddenly in the fierce storms
which must batter this part of the coastline. Back to the south and east
the bay spreads out before you, the waters noticeably calmer directly to
the east.

[36mUpon the Murky Waters[0;37m
     The winds slacken and the water seems to calm a little in this corner
of the bay, a combination of the shelter afforded by the rocky outcrop to
the northwest of you and the thick growth of seaweed visible just under the
surface of the water. The shore laps gently against the rocky patch of
shore to the east, while some ledges not immediately visible amongst the
shadows in the rocks to the west could possible allow you to climb and
reach higher ground. The solemn face of the sheer cliff looms above the
beaches, depriving large portions of the shore of any direct natural light.

[36mRocky Patch of Shore[0;37m
     Large stones of varying sizes litter the white sands, gradually
growing in density and height until it forms an impassable barrier of rock
to the north and west. Small crabs scuttle among shallow pools of water
formed at the bases of some of the larger stones, which provide valuable
protection for some of the smaller life forms on the beach. From this angle
looking over the bay the murky stillness of the waters to the west is
ominously apparent, a sharp contrast to the waves in the southern reaches
of the bay, which appear more animated.

[36mOn a Beach of Fine White Sand[0;37m
     The white sands of the beach spread out underneath you, compressed and
darkened where the waters have recently lapped against them. Small chunks
of wood can be seen buried lightly in the soft sands, their long travels on
the currents having finally deposited them here at some stage during the
last high tide. The telltale tracks of many seabirds cross all over the
beach, marking where they have recently been scouting for food. Small
shrubs have taken root at the base of the tall cliffs soaring above you to
the east, their spindly branches having sustained many months of the
battering winds coming in off the Sirrion Sea from the west.

[36mOn a Beach of Fine White Sand[0;37m
     Almost bleached in appearance, the striking white sands continue
along the eastern shore of the bay, gradually curving to the south behind a
large pile of accumulated driftwood. A sheer rock wall overlooks the bay
from the east, stubbornly resisting both the harsh sea elements and any
attempt to climb its unyielding granite countenance. The waves lap quietly
against the sands, bringing with it the occasional scrap of seaweed
destined to either rot on the beach or be swallowed up by the tides on the
next cycle of the moons. Off in the distance the rough waters of the
Sirrion Sea continue to batter against the rocky barrier unrelentingly, the
echoes of their struggles reverberating off the high cliffs.

[36mPiles of Driftwood[0;37m
     A large pile of wood has accumulated in the corner of the bay, washed
up on the shore by the tides. Some of the trunks have been hollowed out,
while others have been broken and shattered by their travels, laying by the
waters to decay. Mixed in amongst the logs are the occasional hewn and
oiled plank, perhaps part of the ruin of an unfortunate sea faring vessel.
Several spindly shrubs have sprouted through the rear of the pile,
stretching out feebly for the natural light denied in the shadows of the
high cliffs surrounding the bay.

[36mOn a Beach of Fine White Sand[0;37m
     Almost bleached in appearance, the striking white sands continue
along the eastern shore of the bay, gradually curving to the south behind a
large pile of accumulated driftwood. A sheer rock wall overlooks the bay
from the east, stubbornly resisting both the harsh sea elements and any
attempt to climb its unyielding granite countenance. The waves lap quietly
against the sands, bringing with it the occasional scrap of seaweed
destined to either rot on the beach or be swallowed up by the tides on the
next cycle of the moons. Off in the distance the rough waters of the
Sirrion Sea continue to batter against the rocky barrier unrelentingly, the
echoes of their struggles reverberating off the high cliffs.

[36mNearing the Shoreline[0;37m
     The wind picks up as you travel towards the southeastern corner of the
bay, unsettling the waters and forming large patches of white foam on the
surface. Long green strips of seaweed drift just under and on top of the
growing waves, riding on top of their peaks to wash up on the whitened
sands to the east and south. The echoes of the sea crashing against the
stone sentinels at the entrance to this bay bounce back at you from the
high cliff walls, a constant reminder of the ongoing elemental battle
raging nearby.

[36mOn the Bay[0;37m
     The sea breezes intensify, carrying with it the scent of the ocean,
and the reek of the decaying sea weed that floats on its surface in many
places. The shore appears as a large white strip to the east and south,
framed top and bottom by the high stone cliffs and the foaming waters
beneath you. The constant roar of water crashing against stone is thrust
into the background against the solid hiss of the wind, rushing over the
bay and strengthening the waves that break over the shore.

[36mIn the Bay Waters[0;37m
     The rich waters of the bay swirl all around you, forcing the multitude
of long weeds covering the sea floor to dance back and forth lazily with
the currents. Fish and other sea life dart through the leafy fronds,
stirring up the occasional cloud of dirt as they hunt for food in the
waters. The veritable field of seaweed stretches off into the distance as
far as you can see, seeming to grow denser to the north and east.

[36mIn the Weed-Choked Waters[0;37m
     All you can see around you is layer upon layer and row upon row of
thick slimy seaweed clustering about the floor of the bay. The thick sway
gently in the currents, bubbles of air occasionally rising to the surface
from deep below, an area concealed totally by the dense underwater
vegetation. Fish idly swim among the swaying green strips, nibbling on the
tiny life forms that dwell in amongst the thick weeds, before darting
mysteriously away again and disappearing amongst the shadows.

[36mA Hidden Passage Amongst the Weeds[0;37m
     Thick slimy seaweed totally surrounds you, blocking off most of your
visibility and dense enough to prevent you from attempting to break through
into the bay waters. Tiny fish and other aquatic animals peer through the
swaying weeds briefly, before disappearing amongst the thick swaying
strands - following the trails that only fish their size can. Many small
fragments of broken strands whirl about you, some of these being slowly
consumed by the multitude of voracious sea creatures inhabiting this area
of the bay.

[36mThe Underwater Tunnel Ends[0;37m
     The slimy underwater tunnel opens into a small cave, the ceiling
evidently above the water level as you can see the rippling dance of waves
above you. Several handholds have been carved into the ledge at the far end
of the cave, in amongst several strands of thick green seaweed that sways
gently with the currents. Dark passages trail off to the east and south,
leading further into the murky water.

[36mUpon a Thick Layer of Kelp[0;37m
     The tunnel opens out into a small cavern, no other exits visible
besides the way you came from the south. The floor seems to ripple
strangely, and after a second glance you notice it is not solid ground at
all - but a solid interwoven mat of seaweed, covering what must be a body
of water judging from the undulations on the surface. A sickly green glow
illuminates the area, emanating from several points under the living floor,
seeming to float idly from place to place and casting shadows crazily
against the damp stone walls.

[36mA Hidden Passage Amongst the Weeds[0;37m
     Thick slimy seaweed totally surrounds you, blocking off most of your
visibility and dense enough to prevent you from attempting to break through
into the bay waters. Tiny fish and other aquatic animals peer through the
swaying weeds briefly, before disappearing amongst the thick swaying
strands - following the trails that only fish their size can. Many small
fragments of broken strands whirl about you, some of these being slowly
consumed by the multitude of voracious sea creatures inhabiting this area
of the bay.

[36mIn the Weed-Choked Waters[0;37m
     All you can see around you is layer upon layer and row upon row of
thick slimy seaweed clustering about the floor of the bay. The thick sway
gently in the currents, bubbles of air occasionally rising to the surface
from deep below, an area concealed totally by the dense underwater
vegetation. Fish idly swim among the swaying green strips, nibbling on the
tiny life forms that dwell in amongst the thick weeds, before darting
mysteriously away again and disappearing amongst the shadows.

[36mIn the Bay Waters[0;37m
     The rich waters of the bay swirl all around you, forcing the multitude
of long weeds covering the sea floor to dance back and forth lazily with
the currents. Fish and other sea life dart through the leafy fronds,
stirring up the occasional cloud of dirt as they hunt for food in the
waters. The veritable field of seaweed stretches off into the distance as
far as you can see, seeming to grow denser to the north and east.

[36mIn the Bay Waters[0;37m
     The base of the jagged stone pillar that guards the entrance to the
bay stands rooted to the sea floor all long the western edge of this
portion of the bay. The currents from the open sea beyond cool the water,
and bring with it an almost constant parade of sea life that uses these
waters to rest on their long migratory journeys. The waves churning on the
surface is visible even from this far underwater, their violent struggles
creating a frothy white maelstrom when viewed from below.

[36mIn the Bay Waters[0;37m
     The weeds give way to sand on the floor of the bay here, with only the
occasional strand emerging from the depths to sway with the currents.
Boulders of varying sizes lie half buried in the loose sand, many covered
in a thick layer of slime. Schools of tiny fish circle the large rocks,
surveying the area in tightly packed formations, scurrying off into a
thousand directions whenever they sense a disturbance nearby.

[36mIn the Bay Waters[0;37m
     The waters seethe and churn around you, forcefully pushing you about
as you look around. The slick base of the largest column appears as a thick
patch of shadow to the north, while the bases of the smaller rocks emerge
from the swirling sands all around you filter the incoming waters from the
ocean. Even as you watch, several pieces of flotsam are sucked from the
depths between the rocks to drift past you toward shore.

[36mDescending into the Underwater Rift[0;37m
     The bay disappears above the edge of the crevasse as you descend, the
shadows intensifying and the waters growing noticeably colder. The waters
are devoid of any schools of fish, only the occasional strand of seaweed
that have become caught on one of the many jagged pieces of stone
projecting out of the crevasse walls. Occasionally you see tiny bubbles
emerge from the depths below, to drift past you in their rush toward the
surface.

[36mAt the Base of the Underwater Rift[0;37m
     You find yourself deep within a rift in the ocean floor, the surface
represented far above by a small jagged tear of light in the surrounding
darkness. Spread out below you many wrecks litter the base of the rift - a
panorama of nautical failure. The flimsier of the vessels have long since
rotted and disintegrated, leaving only fragments to contribute to the pile.
More recent debris litters the fringes of the mound, laying to rest after
having tumbled in from above, beyond which the shadows seem to linger
momentarily, resolving themselves to be passages in each direction.

[36mBefore a Hole in the Rift[0;37m
     The floor of the underwater rift drops away into below, leaving a
gaping hole that descends further into the murky depths. A vast overhang of
stone looms above, joining with the sheer stone walls of the rift. Wreckage
from sunken sea vessels litter the slab to the west up to its very edge,
leading you to believe that even more debris has fallen into this yawning
abyss. Deep in the hole below you see a light glowing dimly, and you catch
a glimpse of movement.

[36mAn Underwater Chamber[0;37m
     The cabin of a small sailing ship has sunk down into this underwater
chamber through the large hole in the ceiling. A cluster of enchanted
gemstones attached to the rotting frame of the cabin still glows with a
soft magical light, illuminating the surrounding area including the
splintered remains of the rest of the ship which lies strewn about. Small
passages in the north and western walls appear to lead off into further
chambers, an occasional bubble drifts in from the western passage to
disappear up out of sight through the hole in the ceiling.

[36mIn an Underwater Cavern[0;37m
     The walls drift out of sight to either side and you look around to
find yourself in a large underwater cavern. The floor is rocky and uneven,
swathed in shadow and crossed with narrow trenches, ample cover for any
beast that might want to remain concealed. Huge shards of stone project
from the ceiling of the cavern in places, at times almost reaching the
floor some several dozen feet below. A small hole in the southern end of

[36mRuined Chapel[0;37m
     This chamber was once obviously above water, with the rotted remains
of heavy tapestries still stubbornly clinging to the portions of wall which
have not collapsed and sunk into the pile of rubble. Shattered planks and
rotted beams lie amongst the stone, presumably the remains of several hard
wooden benches that once faced the intact obsidian altar resting against
the northern wall. A bas-relief serpent has been carved into a panel raised
above the altar, a large crack running down the middle.

[36mAt the Base of the Underwater Rift[0;37m
     You find yourself deep within a rift in the ocean floor, the surface
represented far above by a small jagged tear of light in the surrounding
darkness. Spread out below you many wrecks litter the base of the rift - a
panorama of nautical failure. The flimsier of the vessels have long since
rotted and disintegrated, leaving only fragments to contribute to the pile.
More recent debris litters the fringes of the mound, laying to rest after
having tumbled in from above, beyond which the shadows seem to linger
momentarily, resolving themselves to be passages in each direction.

[36mIn a Cleft[0;37m
     Here the cleft in the column rises above sea-level, and the waters
rise and ebb with the ocean outside and the multitude of tiny rivulets
streaming through narrow cracks in the stone. Several natural ledges
provide enough support to prevent you from slipping back down into the cold
sea, but there is still enough moisture in the air to stop you from getting
totally dry.

[36mIn a Cramped Corridor[0;37m
     The walls of the short stone corridor are slick with moisture, several
patches covered with a thick coating of slime. The southern end terminates
at a large iron gate, behind which you can hear the roaring of the waves as
they crash into the exterior of the column. The corridor trails off to the
north for a few dozen feet and then ends in a solid wall of stone, which is
pockmarked with small indentations as if a strong acid had been splashed
around.

[36mInside the Stone Column[0;37m
     You find yourself in a small tunnel hollowed out of the stone. The
walls are smooth and dry, at odds with the sound of the waves crashing
against the outside of the column far in the distance, reduced to a distant
murmur. The tunnel opens up into a large chamber to the west, while the
east terminates in a rough stone slab that looks to have collapsed from the
ceiling, perhaps caused by an earthquake or the like.

[36mA Cold Stone Chamber[0;37m
     A large chamber has been somehow hollowed out of the stone column, its
smooth walls soaring up and terminating in the huge square slab that serves
as the ceiling. The only openings appear in the east and north walls, where
tunnels lead off into darkness underneath archways carved with the likeness
of vines. Despite that it must be in close proximity to the ocean waters
this chamber is completely dry, allowing a thick layer of dust to build up
on the floor.

[36mAt the Base of a Carved Stone Stair[0;37m

steps winding their way around the walls to disappear into obscurity
amongst the shadows above. An elaborately carved archway leads into a
larger chamber to the south, while a simple wooden door is embedded in the

engraved in its exact centre.

[36mClimbing a Carved Stone Stair[0;37m
     The wide stairs continue high into the air, the floor of the chamber
below now lost in the shadows. The steps are badly worn and marked in
places, the rough cuts in the stone smoothed over time and use. A light
mist creeps down from above to swirl about your feet, drifting in from an
archway that joins a narrow ledge to the south. The stair continues to
spiral upwards around the edge of the chamber, climbing further into the
column.

[36mA Chamber of Stone[0;37m
     An ornate archway decorates the northern wall of this cold circular
chamber, beyond which is shrouded in shadows. An opening high in the domed
ceiling exposes the chamber to the elements outside, the borders of the
opening decorated by the sketched forms of many different types of birds,
below which hundreds of swirling patterns merge and flow appearing to creep
out onto the remainder of the walls. A bench has been formed around the
edge of the chamber, facing a small shallow pit that has been chipped out
of the stone floor. A light mist hugs the stone floor, seeming to emanate
from the pit.

[36mClimbing a Carved Stone Stair[0;37m
     The wide stairs continue high into the air, the floor of the chamber
below now lost in the shadows. The steps are badly worn and marked in
places, the rough cuts in the stone smoothed over time and use. A light
mist creeps down from above to swirl about your feet, drifting in from an
archway that joins a narrow ledge to the south. The stair continues to
spiral upwards around the edge of the chamber, climbing further into the
column.

[36mFertile Chamber[0;37m
     Thick healthy looking vines and ferns frow around the walls, framing a
clear pond of water against the northern wall of the chamber. The floor is
covered with a thick layer of feathers and bird excrement, evidence of what
must be untold years of habitation by the avian life in the bay. A vine
covered column of stone stretches up through the centre of the room where
it joins with the stalactite encrusted ceiling high above. You can see
several openings in the stone above which allow precious sunlight to feed
the plant life here during the sunlight hours, though simply too high to
attempt to reach.

[36mInside the Hollow Spire[0;37m
     A cramped alcove has been hollowed out from the column of stone in the
same technique as around the rest of this unusual structure. The walls are
smooth and cold, and damp in places from the trails of water that streams
down from an opening in the ceiling. Handholds have been expertly carved
into the walls, allowing you to climb up to, and you imagine beyond, this
dark opening. A small break in the eastern wall allows you to leave back
out to the mercy of the elements.

[36mClimbing the Shaft[0;37m
     The cold rock presses on you from all sides as you climb the narrow
shaft, causing you to brush against the wall sending small fragments of
dirt and stone falling below. Fresh air flows in from above, bringing with
it the scent of salt and the sounds of the many gulls circling the rocks
outside in the bay. A large dark stain covers the stone around the
handholds in one place, surrounded by smaller spatters, resembling blood
that has been spilt and left to congeal on the wall.

[36mAt the Top of the Column[0;37m
     You stand at the centre of a sunken depression right at the very top
of the stone column. Several large stone blocks stand positioned in a
circle around the depression, their weathered granite faces bearing the
faint remnants of intricately etched runes. Three slabs of rock stand side
by side to the north, leaving only a small gap between them. A slight dip
at the top of the depression to the east opens up to a grand view of the
bay far below, reinforcing the fact of how high you are above solid ground
and how easy it would be to fall to your death upon the sharp rocks
surrounding this huge peak jutting out of the ocean.

[36mFar Above the Churning Waves[0;37m

darker in the northeast corner, probably due to the masses of seaweed that

column lies just over to the west, behind which you can see the wide open
seas.

[36mIn the Air Beside the Column[0;37m

of the stone.

[36mAn Alcove in the Column[0;37m
     Concealed behind a jutting ledge, this cold alcove is sheltered from
the gales raging just outside. A large pile of sticks and small shrubs rest
against the far corner, their thin trunks apparently ripped violently from

with many crevasses and jutting pieces of stone, on which several birds
stand and peer at you curiously. The bay waters spread out to the east, and
the sharp rocks below you become more defined, their tips surrounding by
the foaming waters.

[36mAt the Top of the Column[0;37m
     You stand at the centre of a sunken depression right at the very top
of the stone column. Several large stone blocks stand positioned in a
circle around the depression, their weathered granite faces bearing the
faint remnants of intricately etched runes. Three slabs of rock stand side
by side to the north, leaving only a small gap between them. A slight dip
at the top of the depression to the east opens up to a grand view of the
bay far below, reinforcing the fact of how high you are above solid ground
and how easy it would be to fall to your death upon the sharp rocks
surrounding this huge peak jutting out of the ocean.

[36mAbove the Jagged Rocks[0;37m
     The sharp tips of the rocks below are all too apparent, looking
painfully detailed just below you as they pierce the waves with their
jagged peaks. White foam clusters about their bases and high plumes of sea
spray is sent into the air with the crashing waves, the wind sending a fine
mist even this high occasionally.
