[36mNorthern Avenue[0;37m
    You are on Northern Avenue. The road twists and turns here, cutting
through the dense vallenwood forest. High overhead, the limbs mesh to form
a thick green canopy. The avenue continues north, while you see and hear

strong limbs. A small stairway spirals down around the trunk, ending at the
edge of the road. A small sign is posted next to the stairway.

[36mSolace Square[0;37m
    Solace Square is a large clearing that is surrounded on all sides by
huge vallenwood trees. These trees stretch far above the ground and their
limbs provide cover and shelter to the inhabitants of Solace. The clearing
here rises slightly towards the center of the square, providing a high spot
in the center. Small roads have been cut into the dense forest to the
north, south, east, and west. On one edge of the square, there is a huge

[36mSolace Square[0;37m
    Solace Square is a large clearing that is surrounded on all sides by
huge vallenwood trees. These trees stretch far above the ground and their
limbs provide cover and shelter to the inhabitants of Solace. The clearing
here rises slightly towards the center of the square, providing a high spot
in the center. Small roads have been cut into the dense forest to the
north, south, east, and west. On one edge of the square, there is a huge
vallenwood which bough supports a collection of huts and buildings. A
small spiral staircase leads up around the trunk of the tree and into the
thick limbs which house the buildings.

[36mSolace Square[0;37m
    Solace Square is a large clearing that is surrounded on all sides by
huge vallenwood trees. These trees stretch far above the ground and their
limbs provide cover and shelter to the inhabitants of Solace. The clearing
here rises slightly towards the center of the square, providing a high spot
in the center. Small roads have been cut into the dense forest to the
north, south, east, and west. On one edge of the square, there is a huge
vallenwood which bough supports a collection of huts and buildings. A
small spiral staircase leads up around the trunk of the tree and into the
thick limbs which house the buildings.

[32m[0;37m[32m384H [0;37m[33m[1m103V [0;37m29667943X 86.29% 3496C [0;37mT:29 Exits:NW> 
Yimbo gives a cheerful kender a solid punch in the face.

[32m[0;37m[32m384H [0;37m[33m[1m103V [0;37m29667943X 86.29% 3496C [0;37mT:29 Exits:NW> 
Yimbo **ANNIHILATE**s a cheerful kender with his slash.
Fawe stabs a cheerful kender extremely hard.
A cheerful kender misses Fawe with her hit.

[32m[0;37m[32m384H [0;37m[33m[1m103V [0;37m29667943X 86.29% 3496C [0;37mT:28 Exits:NW> 
Yimbo crashes into a cheerful kender in a devastating bash, killing her mercilessly.

[36mCrossing the River White-Rage[0;37m
    Looking around as you cross the immense stone bridge, you gaze in awe
at a pair of huge pillars of stone. The pillars seem to be the main
foundation of the structure, keeping it a safe distance from the raging
waters below. Even from here, you can hear the roar from the river below as
it crashes into the pillars and is forced around them. The stone bridge
stretches northward, high above the river, but the southern bank is still
reassuringly nearby.

elven capitol of Qualinost deepen to the southwest. If you travel south you
can also come upon Pax Tharkas. If you travel north, you will hit the River

[36mNewport Chapel[0;37m
    The chapel is one of the largest and most majestic buildings in Newport.
It is built of fine oak timber and has a few rows of fine wooden pews.
Looking around you see a few statues of some of the gods of the good
pantheon. You recognize Paladine and his sons Kiri-Jolith and Habbakuk.
Placed near Paladine is a statue of Mishakal, the goddess of healing.
Looking to the east you see the lush chapel garden.

    The chapel is one of the largest and most majestic buildings in Newport.
It is built of fine oak timber and has a few rows of fine wooden pews.
Looking around you see a few statues of some of the gods of the good
pantheon. You recognize Paladine and his sons Kiri-Jolith and Habbakuk.

Looking to the east you see the lush chapel garden.

[36mRapid's Drive South[0;37m
    The street gently curves as it follows the strong vallenwood wall that
marks the town's western border. A sturdy guard tower stands above you with
constant lookouts maintained at all hours of the day. To the south, a small
chapel has been built from the finest oak timbers in the land and it stands
majestically above the other buildings in this town. The street swings north
to the west gate and curves gently to the southeast.

[36mA Busy Loading Dock[0;37m

[36mThe Southern Pier[0;37m
    The southern pier of Newport runs along the shore, the waters of the
bay stretching out beyond sight. The wooden planks of the pier bob slightly
with the brush of the tide. There are several ships tied to the mooring
ropes, with various trading symbols painted on their hulls. A pile of boxes
and crates sit here, waiting to be loaded into some ships. A few of the
locals are sitting along the pier, casting their lines into the waters for
the shallow dwelling fish. A large dock extends to the north, where merchants
bustle about looking for new merchandise.

[36mUnder the Pier[0;37m

[36mThe Southern Pier[0;37m
    The southern pier of Newport runs along the shore, the waters of the
bay stretching out beyond sight. The wooden planks of the pier bob slightly
with the brush of the tide. There are several ships tied to the mooring
ropes, with various trading symbols painted on their hulls. A pile of boxes
and crates sit here, waiting to be loaded into some ships. A few of the
locals are sitting along the pier, casting their lines into the waters for
the shallow dwelling fish. A large dock extends to the north, where merchants
bustle about looking for new merchandise.

[36mA Busy Loading Dock[0;37m
    The wooden planks of the dock are covered in stacks of crates, waiting
to be taken by trading ships to other parts of Ansalon. The clear blue
waters of the outer bay become slightly muddied as the water comes closer to
shore. There is a pier running north of here, with several large ships
anchored to mooring lines. To the west, Rapid's Drive runs its curving
course along the outlines of the shore.

the north, signifying the beginnings of a major trade route to the towns of

elven capitol of Qualinost deepen to the southwest. If you travel south you
can also come upon Pax Tharkas. If you travel north, you will hit the River
White Rage.

[36mA Dark Road in the Forest[0;37m

blocking out the sun. You hear the sounds of animals all around you. Since
its fairly dark here, you hear the sounds of night animals out looking for a
good meal. Looking east, the forest is not as thick and the path is lighter.
To the west the forest continues to encroach on the path making the daytime
vanish even more from your sight. You hesitate to go that way.

[36mEmerging From the Forest[0;37m

suprisingly quickly into a barren landscape marred by a recent attack by
the axes of loggers. The surrounding hills that rise up around you are
scarred with rotting stumps, and here and there sage brush occasionally
mars the landscape. Whether your eyes deceive you or not, the way westward
appears to lead downhill into a small valley.

grasses, but very infrequently. Looking westward, you notice that the road
begins to curve to the south towards the distant mountains which contain
the fabled Keep of Pax Tharkas.

appears to lead downhill into a small valley.

blocking out the sun. You hear the sounds of animals all around you. Since

vanish even more from your sight. You hesitate to go that way.

[36mA Quiet Dirt Road[0;37m
    A cool breeze flows in from the south and the road you are on is well
maintained. A soft lush forest embraces this road and the landscape seems to
change at this point. To the north, the lands of Abanasinia stretch out with
rumors of Qualinesti and Darkenwood and places where the Dragon Highlords
rule such as Pax Tharkas and the ruins of Xak Tsaroth. Of course, the fabled
Inn of the Last Home in Solace and the streets of Haven are welcome spots
for the tired traveller. To the south, cold weather prevails as the chilly
winds from the Kharolis and Icereach make these lands inhospitable.

[36mThe Breaks Foothills[0;37m
    These foothills are the favorite hunting ground of the dwarves from
Thorbardin. There is ample game and the spruce and pine forest suggest a
cold but flourishing environment. To the south and west of here, the mighty
Kharolis Mountains rise above the foothills and form an impressive barrier.
The vast plains of Dergoth extend to the northeast, beyond the Breaks
Foothills, and a very large bog has formed to the southeast.

foothills and to the distant west more mountains are visible.

[36mA Steep Mountainous Pass[0;37m
    This part of the road is very steep and treacherous. Rocks are strewn
about on the roadside making the going hard. Looking to the south the road
climbs higher up the mountains and looking to the north the trail heads
down the mountain. In the distant east you can see some forests and far to
the north some foothills.

[36mAt the Foot of a Mountain[0;37m
    The ground here at the foot of the mountain is unnaturally smooth,
almost as if the rock was hewn flat to ease the passage of trade carts. Of
course, there are no cart marks and few bootprints, so perhaps it's just
nature playing tricks on the mind. The unusually flat ground continues and
expands to the west, while a narrow gap between the giant boulders off to
the south allows relatively easy movement in that direction.

[36mAt the Foot of a Mountain[0;37m
    The ground here at the foot of the huge mountain is unnaturally smooth,
almost as if the granite was hewn flat to create a plaza where trade carts
could gather at the foot of the biggest mountain in the region. Of course,
there are no cart marks and few bootprints, even if the smooth area seems
unnaturally wide and the cliff formed by the mountain meeting the ground is
perfectly vertical. The unusually flat ground narrows a bit as it continues
to the east and west from here, flanked by an impervious wall of boulders.

[36mSouthgate[0;37m
    A row of heavy fortifications are arranged facing the southern wall,
designed to protect dwarven warriors in case invaders are somehow able to
break through the giant stone plug known as Southgate. Any invading forces
resilient enough to make it past the first line of defenses will be forced
to suddenly turn right, which makes fighting very awkward for right-handed
fighters, to ascend the huge spiral ramp that leads into Thorbardin.

[36mA Huge Spiral Ramp[0;37m

direction as it ascends nearly fifty feet from bottom to top. The surface
of the ramp is unpaved, but smooth except for the parallel tracks designed
to accommodate merchant carts. A few murder holes are hidden in the wall to
aid in repelling would-be attackers foolish to attempt an invasion.

small side street to the east which leads to a residential area.

[36mAnvil's Echo[0;37m
    This wide stone bridge arches gracefully over a yawning chasm, which
the runes etched in the stone name the chasm Anvil's Echo. Iron tracks run
down the middle of the bridge, and walkways run along either side. Stone
dwarves on both sides of the bridge form a barricade to keep people from
falling off the bridge. The bridge meets the Sixteenth Road at the south
end, while the other end of the bridge lies to the north of here.

[36mSouth Hall of Justice[0;37m
    This great hall is where the royal officers make major decisions about
justice that govern the whole kingdom of Thorbardin. As the dwarven society
is a theocracy where the most important decisions flow from the will of the
god Reorx, this hall also functions as the dwarves' most holy temple. Giant
marble columns depicting the glory and teaching of Reorx march around the
perimeter of the hall, bestowing their wisdom on all who visit. The area to
the west of here has caved in, and the dwarves haven't repaired it yet. The
hall continues north, while bronze doors guard the entrance to the east.

[36mSouth Hall of Justice[0;37m
    This great hall is where the royal officers make major decisions about
justice that govern the whole kingdom of Thorbardin. As the dwarven society
is a theocracy where the most important decisions flow from the will of the
god Reorx, this hall also functions as the dwarves' most holy temple. Giant
marble columns depicting the glory and teaching of Reorx march around the
perimeter of the hall, bestowing their wisdom on all who visit. The area to
the west of here has caved in, and the dwarves haven't repaired it yet. The
hall continues north, while bronze doors guard the entrance to the east.

[36mSouth Hall of Justice[0;37m
    This great hall is where the royal officers make major decisions about
justice that govern the whole kingdom of Thorbardin. As the dwarven society
is a theocracy where the most important decisions flow from the will of the
god Reorx, this hall also functions as the dwarves' most holy temple. Giant
marble columns depicting the glory and teaching of Reorx march around the
perimeter of the hall, bestowing their wisdom on all who visit. A pair of
massive bronze doors guard the entrance to the north, while rubies set into
the ground lead towards the arched bridge to the holy altar to the south.

[36mA Busy Intersection of Roads[0;37m

intersection. The ground is paved with striated granite cobblestones which
have been arranged in angular patterns that form a fourteen-pointed star.
The sign in the center of the intersection says the Ninth Road leads off to
the west, the Fourteenth Road lies north of here, and the Fifteenth Road
extends to the east. At the southern end of the busy intersection stands a
massive marble hall guarded by a pair of gigantic bronze doors.

farming wagons occasionally trundle on by, moving raw materials or finished
goods from one clan's city to another. The Road is wide enough for eight
wagons to pass through, continuing to the east and west from here.

[36mOutside Daerbardin[0;37m
    The giant black iron gate to the south is made of inch-thick bars and
appears to be nigh indestructible. Dwarven runes etched into the dolomite
plaque hanging over the gate proclaim this the entrance to Daerbardin, and
a separate sign opposite the gates indicates that this is the Fifteenth
Road. The dark cobblestones of the Road continue to the west, while to the
east, the Road ends abruptly at the entrance to massive mushroom warrens.

[36mSouth Hall of Justice[0;37m
    This great hall is where the royal officers make major decisions about
justice that govern the whole kingdom of Thorbardin. As the dwarven society
is a theocracy where the most important decisions flow from the will of the
god Reorx, this hall also functions as the dwarves' most holy temple. Giant

perimeter of the hall, bestowing their wisdom on all who visit. A pair of
massive bronze doors guard the entrance to the north, while rubies set into
the ground lead towards the arched bridge to the holy altar to the south.

[36mThe Temple of the Stars[0;37m
    An enormous anvil of red granite stands on a platform suspended over a
bottomless pit by four arching stone bridges holding it up. The runes of
divinity carved around the base of the anvil clearly indicate that it is an
altar to Reorx. The altar gleams proudly under the light of huge glittering
diamonds embedded in the domed black ceiling to resemble stars, arranged
like the constellations of Paladine and Takhisis circling each other. The
bridges lead off in each of the cardinal directions, but since the southern
part of the hall has caved in, the end of that bridge has been blocked.

[36mSouth Hall of Justice[0;37m
    This great hall is where the royal officers make major decisions about
justice that govern the whole kingdom of Thorbardin. As the dwarven society
is a theocracy where the most important decisions flow from the will of the
god Reorx, this hall also functions as the dwarves' most holy temple. Giant
marble columns depicting the glory and teaching of Reorx march around the
perimeter of the hall, bestowing their wisdom on all who visit. Rubies in 
the ground lead towards the arched bridge to the holy altar to the west.

[36mAnvil's Echo[0;37m
    This wide stone bridge arches gracefully over a yawning chasm, which
the runes etched in the stone name the chasm Anvil's Echo. Iron tracks run
down the middle of the bridge, and walkways run along either side. Stone
dwarves on both sides of the bridge form a barricade to keep people from
falling off the bridge. The bridge meets the Sixteenth Road at the north
end, while the other end of the bridge lies to the south of here.

[36mA Huge Spiral Ramp[0;37m

direction as it ascends nearly fifty feet from bottom to top. The surface
of the ramp is unpaved, but smooth except for the parallel tracks designed
to accommodate merchant carts. A few murder holes are hidden in the wall to
aid in repelling would-be attackers foolish to attempt an invasion.

break through the giant stone plug known as Southgate. Any invading forces
resilient enough to make it past the first line of defenses will be forced

fighters, to ascend the huge spiral ramp that leads into Thorbardin.

[36mAt the Foot of a Mountain[0;37m

almost as if the granite was hewn flat to create a plaza where trade carts
could gather at the foot of the biggest mountain in the region. Of course,
there are no cart marks and few bootprints, even if the smooth area seems
unnaturally wide and the cliff formed by the mountain meeting the ground is
perfectly vertical. The unusually flat ground narrows a bit as it continues
to the east and west from here, flanked by an impervious wall of boulders.

mountain, and a sloping path to the east leads back down the mountain.

[36mA Steep Mountainous Pass[0;37m
    This part of the road is very steep and treacherous. Rocks are strewn
about on the roadside making the going hard. Looking to the south the road
climbs higher up the mountains and looking to the north the trail heads
down the mountain. In the distant east you can see some forests and far to
the north some foothills.

[36mNorthgate[0;37m

Kharolis mountains if you are heading south. This region is known to the
dwarves as Northgate, for it signals the northern entrance into their
mountainous domain. South of here the mountains grow taller and the road
leads to the mountain tops. To the north and east you can see forested
foothills and to the distant west more mountains are visible.

[36mA Raised Road[0;37m

to the south. The road has been built up with rocks and dirt to maintain a
dry and stable platform. However in some parts this is not the case and the
bog has reclaimed what originally belonged to it. The bog extends out for
quite some distance to the north and east and a bit to the west. Northward,
beyond the bog is a large plain. You see foothills off to the west, south
and northwest directions.

[36mThe Breaks Foothills[0;37m
    These foothills skirt the eastern edge of the Kharolis Mountains and
provide an excellent place to hunt game. The forests are mainly spruce and
pine, reflecting the cold seasonal climate. There is a large bog to the
south of here and to the northeast, the hills flatten out to the plains of
Dergoth. You can see the snowy peaks on the highest spires of the Kharolis
Mountains to the distant west.

winds from the Kharolis and Icereach make these lands inhospitable.

[36mOld Road in the Forest[0;37m
    The well maintained Old Road continues its path to the north and south.

River White-Rage lies somewhere to the northeast, beyond that lays the
towns of Solace and of Haven. Southwest is the beginnings of the Kharolis
Mountains and the legendary realm of Thorbardin. The Qualinesti forest is
to the west, their capitol lies somewhere to the northwest.

[36mOld Road to the Sea[0;37m
    The forests of what is rumored to be the Qualinesti capitol of
Qualinost fence in the Old Road to the west. The shores of a bay in the New
Sea can be seen clearly to the east. Slightly northeast, the fishing trade
of Newport can be observed, as small fishing boats dock upon its southern
pier. The Old Road continues to improve in condition as the way to the north
turns into a wider, cobblestone road.

trail makes its way through the forest towards the west.

[36mA Path Through the Wilderness[0;37m
    Thick clumps of vibrant green ferns and shrubs grow on either side of
this small path, obscuring vision of almost everything beyond their thick
foliage. Small weeds and saplings have begun to spring through the packed
dirt of the path, suggesting that it has not seen much use in the recent
years. Countless ancient trees dominate the area and their leaves create a
thick canopy high above, parting just enough in small areas to reveal the
sky beyond. The small path continues to weave through the thick wilderness
in both the northern and southern directions.

[36mA Heavily Overgrown Trail[0;37m
    Twisted networks brown roots and hardy brush plants have grown over the
surface of this thin trail, making it difficult to keep track of as it
passes through the forest. The area is alive with the sounds of life which
range from choirs of birds chirping in harmony to the soft rustling of
fallen leaves as nearby creatures forage for food. Gentle winds breeze
between the trees carrying the soft scent of moist plants, a result of
recent rainfall being absorbed by thirsty flora. The faint trail grows
noticeably more pronounced as it winds north, yet it seems to vanish
entirely into the wild forests that grow even thicker to the west.
[33m[1m[0;37m[31m[1m<Myth> Captain Yimbo Slice is standing here. (flying) (white aura)

[36mThe Wild Qualinesti Forest[0;37m
    All signs of civilization have entirely disappeared, utterly consumed
by the wild growth of this untamed forest. The deep green colours of
foliage growing on the ancient trees is beautifully contrasted by the
splendrous reds, purples and yellows of the blooming flowers which are
scattered throughout the surroundings. Fallen leaves and dead twigs cover
the forest floor, slowly decaying to provide nutrients to the other nearby
flora. Beautiful birds flutter through the branches above while insects
scurry along the ground, creating an environment which is in a constant
state of change. The wild forest continues in both the western and southern
directions while a faint, overgrown trail is visible nearby to the east.

[36mSolace Square[0;37m
    Solace Square is a large clearing that is surrounded on all sides by
huge vallenwood trees. These trees stretch far above the ground and their
limbs provide cover and shelter to the inhabitants of Solace. The clearing
here rises slightly towards the center of the square, providing a high spot
in the center. Small roads have been cut into the dense forest to the
north, south, east, and west. On one edge of the square, there is a huge
vallenwood which bough supports a collection of huts and buildings. A
small spiral staircase leads up around the trunk of the tree and into the
thick limbs which house the buildings.

Fawe flies in from above.
[36mSolace Square[0;37m
    Solace Square is a large clearing that is surrounded on all sides by
huge vallenwood trees. These trees stretch far above the ground and their
limbs provide cover and shelter to the inhabitants of Solace. The clearing
here rises slightly towards the center of the square, providing a high spot
in the center. Small roads have been cut into the dense forest to the
north, south, east, and west. On one edge of the square, there is a huge
vallenwood which bough supports a collection of huts and buildings. A
small spiral staircase leads up around the trunk of the tree and into the
thick limbs which house the buildings.

[36mThe Solace Magic Shop[0;37m
    This magic shop is an old and dusty place. Shelves and cases line the
walls and fill the room. Scrolls, books, wands, staves, and all sorts of
magical paraphernalia is on display. The shades on the windows let in stray
rays of light which streak through the dust filled air, making slashes
across the dim room. A faint smell of incense fills the air and you hear
chimes tinkling in the distance. A set of spiral staircase carved into the
tree leads down. The center of the tree can be accessed through a door to
the west.
